summary: This document is a forwarded email chain from September 2021, containing a May 2020 message from a GoFundMe user to a victim. The message expresses sympathy for the victim's health and abuse history, offers support through a foundation called Families Against Cult Teachings (F.A.C.T.), and shares personal experiences with health challenges and spousal abuse. It appears to be part of FBI discovery materials related to the Epstein/Maxwell case.

persons.name: Program Manager Victim Program Management Unit FBI
persons.context: Appears as the initial sender/forwarder of the email chain within the FBI's Victim Program Management Unit.

persons.name: MI (SE) (FBI)
persons.context: FBI agent based in Seattle/Bellingham who forwarded an email about a GoFundMe message response.

events.title: GoFundMe Message to Victim
events.description: A message is sent via GoFundMe to a victim, expressing sympathy for their health challenges and history of abuse, and offering support through a foundation and medical connections.

events.title: Forwarding of GoFundMe Message
events.description: An external email containing the GoFundMe message is forwarded to an FBI agent.

events.title: Internal FBI Email on Discovery
events.description: FBI agents exchange emails regarding 'Epstein/Maxwell Discovery,' specifically concerning email communications.
personsInvolved: Program Manager Victim Program Management Unit FBI

keyFacts: The document is part of FBI discovery materials related to the Epstein/Maxwell investigation, specifically concerning email communications.
It contains a personal message from May 2020 sent via GoFundMe to a victim, offering support related to health challenges and a history of abuse.
The message sender references being on the board of a foundation called 'Families Against Cult Teachings' (F.A.C.T.) which targets cults and trafficking.
The message details the sender's wife's history of being abandoned by her family, sexually abused, trafficked, and raped by three different men for 20 years starting at age 13.
The email chain shows the FBI's Victim Program Management Unit handling and forwarding this correspondence as part of their investigation.
